Majoritem.caption: Define how lists of &1 should be displayed

SubItem.caption: Select the columns to display and to use for identification
Optionally, choose to display lists in a non-default shipped style
SubItem.instruction:
The VLF has 4 out-of-the-box ways to display lists of business objects, referred to as 'instance lists'.
- Simple grid style lists account for most normal usage. Use this option if you don’t know which option to choose.
- Simple expand / collapse style lists show the basic list details in the normal way, but have an option to expand and collapse list items to view, and hide, the rest of the list columns.
- Parent and Child lists are tree style indented lists. To use this style of list you will need to change this business object’s definition to have some associated child business objects. Refer to the VLF documentation for more on this subject and refer to the shipped examples.
- Massive lists are a specialized type of simple grid style list that might be useful when your instance list is used for long periods and has thousands of items in it.
Choose the style of list then click Apply.

SubItem.caption: Choose to display lists in a contact card style
SubItem.instruction:
A contact card style list normally has an image on the left side and the list column details arranged down the right side, arranged similarly to a contact or business card.
Use this option to generate and snap in a basic contact card style list panel which you may then customize to your exact content and layout requirements.
Enter a name for the reusable part to be generated, indicate whether you want to include an image or photograph, then click Create.

SubItem.caption: Choose to display lists in a custom style
SubItem.instruction:
Use this option when none of the shipped ways to display a list match your requirements.
A customized list allows you to present lists in any way that you choose. For instance you might present a list of dates in a calendar style, or a list of images in a carousel.
Use this option to generate and snap in a basic customized list which you can then customize to your exact content and layout requirements.
Enter a name for the reusable part to be generated, then click Create.

Majoritem.caption: Set up how &1 should be searched

SubItem.caption: Allow search over all table views
SubItem.instruction: Use this option to automatically generate a filter for searching the table and a filter for searching every table view. Enter a prefix for the parts that are to be created and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Search over a single table or view
SubItem.instruction: Use this option to generate a filter for searching the table view you have selected. Enter a prefix for the parts that are to be created, select a table view, and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Custom search over a table
SubItem.instruction: Use this option to generate "skeletons" for a filter and its server module. Enter a prefix for the parts that are to be created, and click Create. Once they are created and snapped into your framework, you need to customize them to match your exact requirements. Refer to comments in the generated code about doing this.

SubItem.caption: SQL search over a table
SubItem.instruction:
Use this option to generate an SQL based filter.
Select the fields that the user may enter selection values in, choose how the field value is compared with the table data, click Finish and then click Create.

SubItem.caption: Simple SCRUD (Search, Create, Read, Update and Delete)
SubItem.instruction: Simple data base tables containing a relatively small number of rows may be maintained by setting up their associated business object as automatically generated Simple SCRUD (Search, Create, Read, Update and Delete). Using this option generates a filter, a command handler and a server module that allow the table to be searched and maintained. Enter a prefix for the parts that are to be created and click Create.

Majoritem.caption: Set up commands or options that control how &1 should be displayed or processed

SubItem.caption: Custom
SubItem.Instruction: This option creates and snaps in a command handler and server module "skeletons" to handle your custom command. Enter a prefix for the command handler and server module below, then enter the short caption for your custom command, and click Create. Once they are created and snapped into your framework, you need to customize them to match your exact requirements. Refer to comments in the generated code about doing this.

SubItem.caption: New
SubItem.instruction: This option will create and snap in a command handler and associated server module to handle a "New" command. Typically, a "New" command is used to input details of a new instance of a business object, such as a New Order or New Customer. Enter a prefix for the command handler and server module below and click Create. Once they are created and snapped into your framework you can then customize them.

SubItem.caption: Delete
SubItem.instruction: This option will create and snap in a command handler and associated server module to handle a "Delete" command. Typically, a "Delete" command is used to delete details of an instance of a business object, such as deleting an Order or deleting a Customer. Enter a prefix for the command handler and server module below and click Create. Once they are created and snapped into your framework you can then customize them.

SubItem.caption: Details - including editing
SubItem.instruction: This option creates and snaps in a command handler and associated server module to handle a "Details" command. Typically, a "Details" command is used to display and edit the basic details of an instance of a business object, such as the details of an Order or the details of a Customer. Enter a prefix for the command handler and server module below and click Create. Once they are created and snapped into your framework you can then customize them.

SubItem.caption: Simple CRUD (Create, Read, Update and Delete) combined
SubItem.instruction: This option creates and snaps in a CRUD (Create, Read, Updated and Delete) command handler and associated server module that combine the functionality of the preceding New, Delete and Details options into a single command handler and server module pair. Enter a prefix for the parts that are to be created and click Create.

SubItem.caption: Graph or Chart
SubItem.instruction: This option creates and snaps in a command handler and associated server module skeleton to handle a "Graph or Chart" type of display. Typically, a "Graphs" command is used to display the details of an instance of a business object in some graphical form. Enter a prefix for the command handler and server module below and click Create. Once they are created and snapped into your framework you will then need to customize them to match your exact requirements. Refer to comments in the generated code about doing this.

SubItem.caption: Map
SubItem.instruction: This option creates and snaps in a command handler skeleton to handle a "Map" type of display. Enter a prefix for the command handler below and click Create. Once it is created and snapped into your framework you will then need to customize it to match your requirements. Refer to comments in the generated code about doing this.

SubItem.caption: Notes
SubItem.instruction: This option will create and snap in a notes command handler. Enter a prefix for the command handler and click Create. Once it is created and snapped into your framework you can then customize it.
